sentences.en: A new force ( e . g . a school of thought , etc. ) emerged unexpectedly.
I had just put the dinner on when Jim walked in unexpectedly.
sentences.cn: 我刚把晚饭摆上桌,吉姆突然走进来.

sentences.en: I meant to help him; unexpectedly I have brought him trouble.
sentences.cn: 我想帮助他, 没想到反而给他添了麻烦.

sentences.en: Miserable, and unexpectedly lonely, she went in search of Jean-Paul.
sentences.cn: 内心痛苦、突感寂寞的她去寻找琼－保罗。

sentences.en: Moss had clamped an unexpectedly strong grip on his arm.
sentences.cn: 莫斯突然紧紧抓住他的手臂。
她的去世相当出人意料.

sentences.en: She panics when people pop in unexpectedly, rushing round plumping cushions.
sentences.cn: 一群人冷不防地冒出来，跑来跑去地拍松垫子，这把她吓坏了。

sentences.en: The desire to be a mother may creep up on you unexpectedly.
sentences.cn: 你会不知不觉地产生想当母亲的渴望。

sentences.en: The host attacked the city unexpectedly.
The Indians came out unexpectedly, catching the soldiers off-guard.
sentences.cn: 印第安人突如其来地出现，令士兵们猝不及防。

sentences.en: The invasion was held up by unexpectedly stout resistance.
sentences.cn: 入侵行动因遭遇到了出乎意料的顽强抵抗而受阻。

sentences.en: The phantom used to appear unexpectedly, but mostly during the winter.
sentences.cn: 那个幽灵过去常常出人意料地出现，但是大多在冬季。

sentences.en: The volcano unexpectedly blew up early in the morning.
They were caught in a clinch when their parents returned home unexpectedly.
sentences.cn: 父母突然回家，撞见他俩拥抱在一起。

sentences.en: Unexpectedly it poured with rain and it was impossible to start off.
sentences.cn: 不意大雨如注,无法启程.

trans.tran_cn: 未料到地，意外地，竟，居然，骤然
